data.title: Battles involving the Emirate of Córdoba
data.text:
1.

First Battle of Cellorigo

Cellorigo's First Battle on 882

Overview: The First Battle of Cellorigo was a battle that took place between the Kingdom of Asturias and the Emirate of Córdoba over the castle at Cellorigo and its surrounding countryside in 882.

0 0

2.

Overview: The Raid of 904 (Arabic: الغزو سنة ٢٩١‎, Al-Ġazw sana 291; in Catalan, Ràtzia de 904) was a military campaign (غزو, ġazw) of the Emirate of Cordova against the counties of Pallars and Ribagorza.

0 0

3.

Battle of the Morcuera

865 battle as part of the Spanish Reconquista

Overview: The Battle of the Morcuera, was a battle of the Spanish Reconquista that took place in the Hoz de la Morcuera between the municipalities of Foncea and Bugedo nearby the city of Miranda de Ebro on 9 August ...

0 0

4.

Overview: The Battle of Río Burbia or the Battle of the Burbia River was a battle fought in the year 791 between the troops of the Kingdom of Asturias, commanded by King Bermudo I of Asturias, and the troops of ...

0 0

5.

Siege of Barcelona (801)

Part of the Reconquista

Overview: The siege of Barcelona was a military operation by a Carolingian army with the aim of conquering the city of Barcelona, which had been under Muslim control for 80 years. The siege and conquest were part ...

0 0

6.

Overview: The Second Battle of Cellorigo took place between the Emirate of Córdoba over the castle at Cellorigo and its surrounding countryside in 883 AD.

0 0

7.

Viking raid on Seville

Attack on the Umayyad Emirate of Córdoba, 844

Overview: The Viking raid on Seville, then part of the Umayyad Emirate of Córdoba, took place in 844. After raiding the coasts of what are now Spain and Portugal, a Viking fleet arrived in Seville through the G ...

0 0

8.

Overview: The Raid of 897 (Arabic: الغزو سنة ٢٨٤‎, Al-Ġazw sana 284; in Catalan, Ràtzia de 897) was a military campaign (غزو, ġazw) of the Emirate of Cordova against the County of Barcelona.

0 0

9.

Day of Zamora

Battle during Spanish Reconquista

Overview: The Day of Zamora (Spanish: Día de Zamora), also known as Jornada del Foso de Zamora ("Zamora's trench [moat] Day"), was a battle of the Spanish Reconquista that took place at the city of Zamora, Spain ...

0 0

10.

Overview: The Battle of Polvoraria was a battle in 878 between troops under Alfonso III of Asturias and a Muslim force under emir Muhammad I of Córdoba. It occurred near the confluence of the Orbigo and Esla rivers ...

0 0

11.

Battle of Las Babias

Historic battle on the Iberian peninsula

Overview: The Battle of Las Babias occurred in the year 795 when the Emir of Cordoba, Hisham I of Córdoba sought to avenge his previous military incursions in 794 against the Kingdom of Asturias under the command ...

0 0

12.

Overview: The Battle of Pancorbo was a battle that took place in the year 816 between a Moorish army from the Emirate of Cordoba sent by Al-Hakam I and under the control of Abd al-Karim ibn Abd al-Wahid ibn Mugit ...

0 0

13.

Battle of Guadalacete

852 battle

Overview: The Battle of Guadalacete was fought in 852 between a coalition of troops from the Kingdom of Asturias and the Kingdom of Navarre, and a force of troops from the Muslim Emirate of Córdoba under the command ...

0 0

14.

Overview: The Battle of Lutos occurred in the year 794 when the Emir of Cordoba, Hisham I of Córdoba sent military incursions against the Kingdom of Asturias under the command of the brothers Abd al-Karim ibn Abd ...

0 0

15.

Battle of Orbieu River

793 battle

Overview: The battle of Orbieu River was a military engagement between the Umayyads of Spain and the Frankish army led by William of Gellone, the Duke of Toulouse. The Umayyads defeated the Franks and returned with ...

0 0

16.

Overview: The siege of Tortosa was a military campaign by King Louis the Pious of Aquitaine in 808–809. It was part of a decade of intense activity by Louis against the Umayyad Emirate in the region of the lower ...

0 0

17.

Battle of Albelda (851)

9th-century battle of the Reconquista

Overview: The first Battle of Albelda took place near Albelda in 851 between the Muslim forces of Musa ibn Musa, chief of the Banu Qasi and governor of Tudela on behalf of the Emirate of Córdoba, and an army of ...

0 0
